about_the_game:
Unconventional Path: This is a city-building game without 3D graphics, but that doesn't stop you from creating a massive city with millions of inhabitants! Different wealth groups, building densities, and industries will all converge in the vast metropolis you build with your own hands!

Hexagonal Grid Map
Each plot will have its influence and commuting range. As the city expands, you, as the mayor, need to plan and place plots to maximize tax revenue, reduce expenses, and ensure the healthy development of the city.



"3D" City
Different wealth groups, building densities, and industries will bring distinct areas to the city, such as industrial zones, commercial districts, and office CBDs. You can plan wherever you want according to your wishes.

Pay Attention to Citizen and Business Feedback
Each residence or business has its own needs. Please try to meet their needs while ensuring the healthy development of the city, otherwise, it may lead to negative impacts such as a halt in population growth and a decline in tax revenue.



Plan Transportation
Although this game doesn't require building roads, each plot will have a certain commuting time. Excessive commuting time can prevent two plots from establishing a connection. For example, if a residential area cannot go to another commercial area for shopping, you can use public transportation or replan the functions of the plots to reestablish connections!

Use Information Layers
Like every city-building game, information layers are a very useful tool that can help you quickly grasp various information in the city, providing important references for the decisions of all mayors.

Day-Night Cycle
Experience the changing times of day, allowing you to admire your city both during daylight and under the night sky. As night falls and the city lights up, you'll feel a deep sense of pride as the mayor, watching over the countless glowing windows.



Various Terrains
In the game, different terrains allow for different buildings or zones, and different maps may bring different challenges.

Finally, I wish all mayors a pleasant gaming experience!
